comments:
Hi,
 I am using Eclipse on Linux
 Version: 3.1.0
Build id: I20050527-1300
 I have two problems
1) I frequently get a pop up saying "Could not save master table". When I see the error log I get the following msg.
(Exception Stack Trace)
java.io.FileNotFoundException: /opt/fineye/workspace/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.core.resources/.safetable/org.eclipse.core.resources (Permission denied)
at java.io.FileOutputStream.openAppend(Native Method)
at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:177)
at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:102)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.SafeChunkyOutputStream.<init>(SafeChunkyOutputStream.java:43)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.SafeChunkyOutputStream.<init>(SafeChunkyOutputStream.java:39)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.saveMasterTable(SaveManager.java:1049)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.saveMasterTable(SaveManager.java:1042)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.save(SaveManager.java:1019)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.DelayedSnapshotJob.run(DelayedSnapshotJob.java:44)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)
(Session Data)
eclipse.buildId=unknown
java.version=1.4.2_08
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86
This is a continuation of log file /opt/fineye/workspace/.metadata/.bak_1.log
Created Time: 2006-01-31 09:50:48.218

I also get this error when i see in the Problem view
"The project was not built due to "Errors saving CVS synchronization information to disk. Please fix the problems listed below and then update the affected resources from the CVS repository.". Fix the problem, then try refreshing this project and building it since it may be inconsistent	Insight			January 31, 2006 10:12:06 AM"

Please help me with these two errors

Thanks in Advnace

I suspect this is a problem with your permissions. Do you have write access to

/opt/fineye/workspace/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.core.resources/.safetable/org.eclipse.core.resources

Moving to Resources

As the error says, this is a problem where Eclipse doesn't have the necessary permissions to update its own metadata files.  If you grant the necessary permissions to the .metadata directory and below, this should solve your problems.
